EmailTemplate.name: TH 2014 - Final Email
EmailTemplate.subject: Thailand: Trip Information
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi!
Iâ€™m sure by now you are getting very excited as we are now entering the final weeks before the trip begins. We wanted to send out one last email full of information that will be useful to you as you prepare for your departure!
HOTEL CHANGE:
We have had a hotel change in Chiang Saen. There was something that came up at Serene Hotel (where we were going to be originally) and now we are going to be at Gin's Maekong View Hotel:
http://www.agoda.com/en-ca/gin-s-maekhong-view-resort-and-spa/hotel/chiang-saen-golden-triangle-chiang-rai-th.html
Hotel Address: 225 M.8 T.Wieng A.Chiang Sean, Chiang Saen, Chiang Saen / Golden Triangle (Chiang Rai), Thailand 57150
**Wifi and laundry are available at the hotel**
Packing:
- Attached you will find a packing list. This will remind you of all the little things that will make your trip and travels more comfortable.
- You are also invited to bring a yoga mat if you want to join Christal for some morning yoga! Even if you donâ€™t have a mat, youâ€™re welcome to join the fun.
- More Specific Packing Reminders:
Thai culture, especially in the area that we are working in, is quite a bit more modest than what some of us are used to. We ask that when we are working at the home we all wear longer shorts and t-shirts. Tank tops are ok if they have wider straps. The children have all come from exploitative situations and we do our best to make them as comfortable as possible.
Please bring both flip flops (you never wear shoes inside a doorway and flip flops will be way less hassle!) and close toe work shoes for the work days. We will have places to leave everything, our driver and van is always on site and there is no worry about losing anything.
As for the evenings, we will be going out for dinner every night, either at the hotel or to local restaurants to give you a chance to try the excellent cuisine in the area. I personally dress up for dinner in a casual dress or pants, and bring an outfit for our special night out with the staff that we will do one evening during the second week (be prepared to get your karaoke game on!!)
Also, please remember that you will need an electrical adapter in order to use any outlets there.
In regards to swimming, we have a pool at our hotel and you can rock your bikinis or speedos :) if you want there. However, when we are swimming with the kids we all wear t-shirts and longer shorts. The kids will all be wearing that and it is, again, a comfort level. Even the male workers will be wearing t-shirts with the kids when swimming. And, fyi, swimming at a river with waterfalls with that many kids is a wild time!
Also, you will each have the opportunity to spend one or more evenings at the home with the kids and experience life there from a different perspective. Again, you don't have to go, but the option is available if you choose it.
Emergency Contact Info:
Here are two emergency numbers for you to leave with family/friends. We will have more numbers available to you on the first day.
Christal Earle: 090 473 8732
New (Nanthani): 081 724 0185
Upon Arrival:
When you arrive at the airport, our staff will be at the gate wearing a Live Different t-shirt and holding a Live Different sign. You will then be taken to the hotel.
Schedule:
At the orientation, you will receive the updated itinerary and other pertinent info.
Project:
We are planning on doing a variety of projects. The mornings will be focused on a creative arts camp and working with the kids to create memory books for themselves (they don't have any written history of themselves or their family, so this is a unique opportunity for them to document and show off their talents and connect to their history and sense of belonging). They also want to create a CD with their music team while we are there and Brett will probably be helping them with that. IF any of you are musical, this could be a great time for you to connect with them in this way as well.
In the afternoons we will be doing a work project that focuses around helping to put up a new greenhouse on the property. This project is great for two reasons: it will help them to create some sustainable income (they will sell some of it at the local market) and it will help the children learn how to take care of plants and give them an opportunity to have some fresh food for themselves.
We will also take one day to go to the border and visit the drop in centre there, meet the staff and better understand what they are focused on doing there to help protect vulnerable children and families.
We will have the opportunity to go across to Myanmar when we are there, and the cost is $15 USD for the visa if you choose to go across, visit the markets and join us on a brief tour of the areas that they work in. There is no obligation to go, but it is a great experience.
Excursions:
As of right now, we are pretty sure that we have confirmed the opportunity to be mahouts for a day at a local elephant sanctuary! For those of us who have done it in the past, it has been a major life moment as we actually sit on the elephants, take them to the river for a bath and have an incredible experience learning about them and their history.
We are working with the sanctuary (which is a local supporter of the home) to give us a deal of around $35-$50 USD (1000-1500 baht) for the morning. I will confirm the price with you as soon as they get back to our staff there.
Exchange:
You can bring CAD cash with you and exchange it at the airport or local banks with no problems at all.
There are also local ATM's everywhere if you need more cash. Credit cards are only an option in the city or at department stores, so don't count on being able to use them very much.
Thatâ€™s all for now! If you have any questions at all, please email Christal at christal@livedifferent.com.
Any last minute administrative things (ex. Paperwork, flight info, insurance info, etc.) can be emailed to jenn@livedifferent.com.
Sincerely,
Christal Earle
Co Founder
Jenn Digiandomenico
Program Administrator
